title: You should be able to use quickcast on some abilities and quickcast with indicator on others.
body: In the in-game options you can choose to set some abilities to normal cast and others to quickcast. For example, on lee sin you might typically use normal cast for most abilities but you could set your ward and w abilities to be quickcast for better ward hops. I always use quickcast with indicator, but for a few abilities (like ward hops on lee sin) I would prefer to have standard quickcast. Currently if you select qucikcast with indicator it forces all abilities that are quickcasted to have the indicator and there is no way for you to set some abilities to have the indicator and others to be standard quickcast. This would be a great little change in my opinion if you could select normal cast, quickcast, or quickcast with indicator for each ability separately.

What is the difference between quick cast and quick cast with indicators? I thought it was just visual, is that not true?

With a quickcasted ability the ability fires as soon as you press the button, with quickcast with indicators the ability is fired when you release the button. With indicators allows you to hold down the button to see the range of the button without firing, then let go of the key to use the ability. Kind of a mix between quickcast and normal cast, you can see the range but don't have to press the button twice.

You still can enable indicator before using the ability. It's in settings for keybindings.

Quick how to:
1. Enable quick cast on all abilities.
2. Go to keybindings.
3. Set keybinding for normal cast. It can't be just Q for your Q or it changes the quick cast. But shift+Q does work.

Alternatively (like if you only want it for some champions) it's not hard to disable quick cast on some of your abilities before the game. I ALWAYS play Nami with her Q on normal cast instead of quick cast. I used to only play Ahri with normal cast (except for her R since it's impossible to take off quick cast for that ability.)

Some abilities like Karthus' Lay Waste, Yasuo's Steel Tempest, and Vayne's Tumble (which are all Qs) will not have range indicators whether or not you have range indicators turned on. This is by design since their release and I doubt Riot will ever change it to show their ranges. The reason being is that those Qs are super low cooldown and are CORE to the characters gameplay in the perspective that they almost replace the mechanical need to basic attack, just as basic attacks don't inherently show attack ranges UNLESS you use attack move.
